headline.main: 305 Bodies Exhumed By Bosnia Muslims From a Mass Grave

lead_paragraph: The remains of 305 Bosnian Muslims, probably killed by Bosnian Serb forces in the 1995 Srebrenica massacre, have been excavated from a mass grave in northeastern Bosnia, the head of a commission on missing persons said today. Amor Masovic, the president of the Muslim-led commission, said the mass grave was in the village of Litje, near Zvornik.
abstract: Muslim-led commisssion on missing persons reports that remains of 305 Bosnian Muslims, probably killed by Bosnian Serb forces in 1995 Srebrenica massacre, have been exhumed from mass grave in northeastern Bosnia; since end of war, remains of more than 5,000 people have been exhumed around Srebrenica; killings have been deemed 'genocide' by United Nations war crimes tribunal in The Hague (S)
